org.threadly.test.concurrent

Class TestRunnable

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.threadly.test.concurrent.TestRunnable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class TestRunnable
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

    Generic runnable implementation that can be used in unit tests for verifying execution occurred.

    This structure is used extensively within threadly's own unit tests. Please use those as examples using this class.

    Since:
    1.0.0

    • Constructor Detail

      • TestRunnable

        public TestRunnable()
        Constructs a new runnable for unit testing.

      • TestRunnable

        public TestRunnable(int runTimeInMillis)
        Constructs a new runnable for unit testing. This constructor allows the parameter for the runnable to sleep after handleRunStart() was called and before handleRunFinish() is called.
        Parameters:
        runTimeInMillis - time for runnable to sleep in milliseconds

    • Method Detail

      • setRunDelayInMillis

        public void setRunDelayInMillis(int runDelayInMillis)
        Changes the amount of time the runnable will sleep/block when called. This change will only be for future run calls that are not already blocking.
        Parameters:
        runDelayInMillis - new amount to wait when run is called

      • getRunDelayInMillis

        public int getRunDelayInMillis()
        Getter for the currently set amount of time the TestRunnable will block after handleRunStart() and before handleRunFinish() is called.
        Returns:
        current set sleep time in milliseconds

      • getCreationTime

        public long getCreationTime()
        Returns the millis returned from Clock.accurateForwardProgressingMillis(), that was recorded when this runnable was constructed.
        Returns:
        Forward progressing time in milliseconds TestRunnable was constructed

      • ranConcurrently

        public boolean ranConcurrently()
        Check if this instance has ever been detected to run concurrently. Keep in mind that just because this call returns false does not guarantee the runnable is incapable of running parallel. It does it's best to detect a situation where it is started while another instance has not returned from the run function. Adding a delay in handleRunStart(), handleRunFinish(), or in the constructor increases the chances of detecting concurrency.
        Returns:
        True if this instance ran in parallel at least once

      • ranOnce

        public boolean ranOnce()
        Getter to check if the runnable has run exactly once.
        Returns:
        true if the runnable has been called once

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Check to see if the run function has started but has not completed returned yet.
        Returns:
        True if the runnable's run function is being called currently.

      • getRunCount

        public int getRunCount()
        Getter for the number of times the run function has completed.
        Returns:
        The number of times the run function has been called

      • getDelayTillFirstRun

        public long getDelayTillFirstRun()
        This function blocks till the first run completes then will return the time until the first run started it's call.
        Returns:
        The amount of time between construction and run being called

      • getDelayTillRun

        public long getDelayTillRun(int runNumber)
        This function blocks till the run provided, and then gets the time between creation and a given run.
        Parameters:
        runNumber - the run count to get delay to
        Returns:
        The amount of time between construction and run being called

      • getDelayTillRun

        public long getDelayTillRun(int runNumber,
                            int timeout)
        This function blocks till the run provided, and then gets the time between creation and a given run.
        Parameters:
        runNumber - the run count to get delay to
        timeout - timeout to wait for given run count to finish
        Returns:
        The amount of time between construction and run being called

      • blockTillFinished

        public void blockTillFinished()
        Blocks until run has completed at least once. Will throw an exception if runnable does not run within 10 seconds.

      • blockTillFinished

        public void blockTillFinished(int timeout)
        Blocks until run has completed at least once.
        Parameters:
        timeout - time to wait for run to be called before throwing exception

      • blockTillFinished

        public void blockTillFinished(int timeout,
                              int expectedRunCount)
        Blocks until run completed been called the provided quantity of times.
        Parameters:
        timeout - time to wait for run to be called before throwing exception
        expectedRunCount - run count to wait for

      • blockTillStarted

        public void blockTillStarted()
        Blocks until run has been called at least once. Will throw an exception if run is not called within 10 seconds.

      • blockTillStarted

        public void blockTillStarted(int timeout)
        Blocks until run has been called at least once.
        Parameters:
        timeout - time to wait for run to be called before throwing exception

      • run

        public final void run()
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • handleRunStart

        public void handleRunStart()
                    throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Function to be overloaded by extending classes if more data or operations need to happen at the run point. This is also the first call to be made in the runnable, but all necessary TestRunnable actions are in a finally block so it is safe to throw any exceptions necessary here.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - only InterruptedExceptions will be swallowed

      • handleRunFinish

        public void handleRunFinish()
        Function to be overloaded by extending classes if more data or operations need to happen at the run point. This is the last call to be made in the runnable. If you want a RuntimeException to get thrown to the caller, it must be thrown from here.
